result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore R Guerra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Washington County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have supervised contact with S.G.G., dob 4-29-05 and never be alone with her.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: All conditions to Count 1 are inclusive of Count 2.

records.addlTxt: Letter received from Atty. Hanson
Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Victim also appears.  State moves to amend to 2 Counts of Class A Misdemeanor Neglect of Child-948.21(1)(a), Court grants amendment.  No contest plea entered to Count 1 and Count 2 as amended.   Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and Count 2 and enters judgment.  Statements by Angela G.  Court enters judgment.

Atty. Schmaus advised defendant's wife not available for plea hearing on 2-10-15 and anticipate proceeding to sentencing.  Reset Plea hearing from 2-10-15 to a Plea/Sentencing hearing on 2-17-15 at 11:00 a.m..
Defendant stuck in traffic, court permits scheduling without defendant present.  Reset Hearing from 1-29-15 to 2-10-15 at 2:30 p.m. for projected plea.
Atty. Schmaus request to not hold the Motion to Suppress on 1-29-15 to work out potential resolution but will still appear to make a record.
Reset Motion from 12-22-14 to 1-29-15 at 8:30 a.m., confirmed with counsel and requested motion be filed.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statements
Letter received from Atty. Hanson
Motion hearing on December 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Def in person & by Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Reading of information waived, Court accepts waiver. Not guilty plea entered, Court accepts plea; Defense to file motion for suppression ; Court orders motion to be filed by noon on 11/21/14;  Court will address scheduling of jury trial at a later date.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Arraignment on November 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Def in person & by Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State files an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Victim requests to be present for sentencing hearing
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  The psychosexual report has been provided to the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Reset Hearing from 8-28-14 to 9-17-14 at 1:15 p.m. as counsel awaiting psychosexual report.
Sent copy of Complaint to Atty Hayes per request & payment recd 8-11-14
Hearing on August 28, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Mark D Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel rqst. adj. for a psychosexual examination and doctor unable to generate report until early/mid August and rqst. adj. for report and for additional pretrial.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in person w/Atty Gary Schmaus.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State leaves condition changes at the Court's discretion.  Victim's mother makes statements on bond conditions.  Court modifies bond conditions.  Defendant waives timing on preliminary hearing.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing on 7/2/14 at 8:15 am.
Contact with his children under supervision of the mother
Contact with children by phone or in writing supervised by mother being on phone line and read note/letter first; No contact with family home on Stratford Rd; Signed 5/7/14
Hearing scheduled on 5/27/14 at 3:30pm in Br 1; Sent 5/7/14
Petition for Appointment of Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order.; Signed 4/9/14

No contact, direct or indirect, with his three children SGG, GG, GG, and no contact with family home on Stratford in West Bend except one 20 minute visit with law enforcement to obtain belongings; Signed 4/9/14
Hearing on May 7, 2014 at 3:30 pm; Sent 4/9/14

Defendant appears in person and with Atty Gary Schmaus.  State appears by Atty Stephanie Hanson.  Clerk: EZ.  State rqst. adj. and will hold a conference with the defendant and mother of children rqst bond modification.  Mother of victim states request to have some supervised visitation with the children as has been 5 weeks since father and children have had contact.  Court modifies bond to permit contact by phone with mother on another line at all times and if letter written that mother shall read the letter/note first.  Hearing on 5-27-2014 3:30 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya Perez Reyes of State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter J Cannon for State.  Clk: CP.  Bail/Bond hearing.  Court has reviewed reports and finds probable cause.  Statements from State and counsel.  Def does not qualify for SPD representation.  Court sets $5000 signature bond.  Def req court appointed counsel.  Court appoints Atty Schmaus; Def to reimburse for cost of counsel at rate of $25/month comm 5/15/14.  State to file complaint in May.  Court sets hearing 5-7-14 at 3:30pm in Br 1.
